member.name: T:C1.WPF.FlexGrid.C1FlexGridGroupPanel
member.summary: Class that provides a UI for manipulating groups in a control that is bound to an .

remarks.para: The is an independent element that is connected to a through the property.

The shows a panel and allows users to create groups by dragging column headers into the panel. Users can reorder the groups by dragging the group markers, or sort and remove groups by clicking the group markers.
The appearance of the group markers is automatically determined by the grid that is connected to the . You don't have to select any fonts or brushes.
The XAML below shows how you would create a and connect it to a grid:
remarks.code: <c1:C1FlexGridGroupPanel x:Name="_groupPanel" Grid.Row="0" Background="WhiteSmoke" FlexGrid="{Binding ElementName=_flex}" WatermarkText="Drag column headers here to create groups." MaxGroups="8" HideGroupedColumns="True" DragMarkerColor="#312DFF" />
